2006 FIFA World Cup squads

\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t\tJump to:\t\t\t\t\tnavigation, \t\t\t\t\tsearch\n\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t

This article lists the confirmed national football squads for the 2006 FIFA World Cup tournament held in Germany, between 9 June and 9 July 2006. Before announcing their final squad, several teams named a provisional squad of 23 to 33 players, but each country\'s final squad of 23 players had to be submitted by 15 May 2006. Replacement of injured players was permitted until 24 hours before the team\'s first World Cup game. Players marked (c) were named as captain for their national squad. Number of caps counts until the start of the World Cup, including all pre-tournament friendlies. Club information is that used by FIFA.[1] Players for whom this information changed during or in the run up to the tournament are indicated by footnotes.

Player representation by league[edit]

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n

\n

The squads for Italy and Saudi Arabia were made up entirely of players from their respective domestic leagues. Saudi Arabia were the only team with no players from European clubs. The Ivory Coast squad was made up entirely of players employed by foreign clubs, and 22 out of the 23 players were registered in Europe. Although Turkey, Scotland, and Russia failed to qualify for the finals, their domestic leagues were represented by 12, 11, and 10 players respectively. In total, domestic leagues from 48 different countries had players at the 2006 World Cup.

The 31-year-old OFK Beograd defender was drafted in as a replacement for injured striker Mirko Vu\xc4\x8dini\xc4\x87 by coach Ilija Petkovi\xc4\x87, who is also the player\'s father. However, he did not fly to Germany with the squad, saying \'The pressure was too much for me, my father and my team-mates.\' [permanent dead link]
    29. \n
  29. ^ Since Petkovi\xc4\x87 quit, Serbia and Montenegro national team is the only 2006 World Cup team to have only 22 players on the squad.
    30. \n
  30. ^ Vuki\xc4\x87 has spent the run up to the tournament on loan to Partizan
    31. \n
  31. ^ Ljuboja was on loan to VfB Stuttgart prior to the tournament, and joined them permanently afterwards.
    32. \n
  32. ^ Stojkovi\xc4\x87 has agreed to join Nantes after the tournament.
    33. \n
  33. ^ Jo\xc3\xa3o Ricardo became a free agent after the tournament
    34. \n
  34. ^ Akw\xc3\xa1 became a free agent after the tournament
    35. \n
  35. ^ Marques has spent the run-up of the World Cup on loan to Hull City
    36. \n
  36. ^ Nekounam joined Osasuna after the tournament.
    37. \n
  37. ^ Salcido joined PSV Eindhoven after the tournament.
    38. \n
  38. ^ Osorio joined VfB Stuttgart after the tournament.
    39. \n
  39. ^ Pardo joined VfB Stuttgart after the tournament.
    40. \n
  40. ^ Borgetti joined Al Ittihad after the tournament.
    41. \n

    42. \n

    47. \n

    48. \n
  48. ^ Koller joined Monaco after the tournament.
    49. \n

    50. \n

    51. \n

    52. \n
  52. ^ Grosso joined Internazionale after the tournament.
    53. \n
  53. ^ Howard spent the 2006\xe2\x80\x9307 season on loan to Everton.
    54. \n
  54. ^ Albright was called up after an injury to Frankie Hejduk.
    55. \n
  55. ^ Berhalter, who joined 1860 Munich after the World Cup, was called up after an injury to Cory Gibbs.
    56. \n
  56. ^ Popovic\'s Crystal Palace contract expired after the tournament.
    57. \n
  57. ^ Skoko has spent the run-up of the tournament on loan to Stoke City.
    58. \n
  58. ^ Lazaridis joined Perth Glory after the tournament.
    59. \n
  59. ^ Beauchamp has agreed to join 1. FC N\xc3\xbcrnberg after the tournament.
    60. \n
  60. ^ Thompson has spent the run-up of the tournament on loan to PSV Eindhoven.
    61. \n
  61. ^ Kennedy has agreed to join 1. FC N\xc3\xbcrnberg after the tournament.
    62. \n
  62. ^ Z\xc3\xa9 Roberto became a free agent after the tournament
    63. \n
  63. ^ Mineiro was called up after an injury to Edm\xc3\xadlson
    64. \n
  64. ^ Pletikosa was on loan to Hajduk Split in the run-up to the tournament
    65. \n
  65. ^ Tudor was on loan to Siena in the run-up to the tournament
    66. \n
  66. ^ Niko Kova\xc4\x8d joined Red Bull Salzburg after the tournament.
    67. \n
  67. ^ Jerko Leko joined Monaco after the tournament.
    68. \n
  68. ^ Ivan Bo\xc5\xa1njak joined Genk after the tournament.
    69. \n
  69. ^ Nakata was on loan to Bolton Wanderers in the run-up to the tournament.
    70. \n
  70. ^ Takahara has agreed to join Eintracht Frankfurt after the World Cup.
    71. \n
  71. ^ Landreau has agreed to join Paris Saint-Germain after the tournament.
    72. \n
  72. ^ Govou was called up as a replacement for the injured Djibril Ciss\xc3\xa9.
    73. \n
  73. ^ Zidane retired from football after the tournament.
    74. \n
  74. ^ Barthez became a free agent after the tournament.
    75. \n
  75. ^ Frei joined Borussia Dortmund after the tournament.
    76. \n
  76. ^ David Degen joined Borussia M\xc3\xb6nchengladbach after the tournament.
    77. \n
  77. ^ Yakin was called up after an injury to Johan Vonlanthen.
    78. \n
  78. ^ "Confusion over Pfister comeback". BBC Sport. British Broadcasting Corporation. 12 June 2006. Archived from the original on 1 January 2007. Retrieved 28 April 2011.  Disputes over the Togo players\' pay bonuses caused Pfister to walk out after Togo\'s first match, but he returned before their second match.
    79. \n
  79. ^ Akoto have not played for Admira Wacker since the end of 2005 due to a contract dispute, and spent the run up to the tournament training with Austrian club Schwechat.
    80. \n
  80. ^ Franck Atsou replaced Karim Guede
    81. \n
  81. ^ Asier del Horno was originally named in the squad, but sustained an ankle injury in the build-up to the tournament. Pern\xc3\xada joined Atl\xc3\xa9tico Madrid after the tournament.
    82. \n
  82. ^ Mehdi Meriah was originally named in the squad but sustained an injury in the week leading up to the tournament. He was replaced by Guemamdia.
    83. \n
  83. ^ Issam Jomaa was originally named in the squad but sustained an injury prior to the tournament. He was replaced by Ben Saada.
    84. \n
  84. ^ Karim Saidi has spent the run up to the tournament on loan to Lecce
    85. \n
  85. ^ Yatsenko was called up as a replacement for the injured players Serhiy Fedorov and Vyacheslav Shevchuk.
    86. \n
  86. ^ Shevchenko joined Chelsea after the tournament.
    87. \n
  87. ^ Sviderskyi was on loan to Arsenal Kyiv in the run-up to the World Cup.
    88. \n
